sections.MISSION:
1/2CR Squadron & Troop Mortars conduct Mortar Gunnery from 15 NOV – 08 DEC 2023 in order to certify all Sections to support IDF requirements IAW GTA SOP #1 requirement and TC 3-20.33 (AUG ‘17 edition).
Commander’s
sections.PURPOSE: Recertify Gun Crews and FDC to maintain training proficiency on 60mm, 81mm, and 120mm Mortar Systems.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Complete TBL 1 (Gunner’s Exam) for all 11C Complete TBL 2-3 (FDC 1 and 2 Exams) for all Section Chiefs and Leaders
CFFT simulator completed by unit FOs, to synchronize, Fires certification Complete TBL IV-VI Mortar LFX
sections.END STATE:
MTR Platoon and TRP Sections qualify on their respective weapon systems and FDC criteria.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall initial risk to be low as a result of an seldom probability of a catastrophic event; I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to an unlikely probability of a catastrophic event.Most Dangerous Risk: Night MovementsMitigation: Ensure proper PCC/PCIs  before leaving for the field. Control the movement pace and provide clear emergency procedures to ensure soldiers can safely reorient themselves. In case of difficult terrain, use appropriate lights and communications equipment to call for help.Most Likely Risk: Slips, Trips, and Falls with Heavy EquipmentMitigation: Ensuring proper PPE is worn during operations and slowing down any nonessential movement to ensure soldiers move heavy equipment through the woods. Part of the mitigation will be to brief about weather conditions and empower soldiers to modify any surface deem unsafe before and during the training event. Moving a controlled rate in order to prevent slips, trips ,and fall.
